dialogue: Wait. You know my name?
Roz and I go way back. Brightbill, you have an amazing journey ahead. I envy you, nothing can equal a goose’s first migration.
Thank you!
I would be delighted if you would join my group. It’s been ages since I had a youngster in my formation. What do you say?
I promise I’ll keep up.
Lock in close on my right side. No...left...I mean, this side.
This flight is a gift Roz has given you.
Yeah, I understand.
No, you don’t. You see any other geese here your size? The accident that killed your family, saved you.
I-- I never thought of it that way.
Funny, how life works.
Brightbill.
I-- I could use a boost.
I forgot to say something before I left.
Maybe they heard it anyway. Sometimes hearts have their own conversations.
We must descend, find shelter while this blows over. Stay close.
There. Follow me.
Come on.
Stay hidden. We can rest here till the worst is over. Noise to a minimum, please. Honkington, stop nibbling on everything.
Migrations sure are tiring, huh? Yeah. They all hate me.
Roz? Roz. What are you doing here? I’m so glad to see you. There’s something I needed to tell you, but there wasn’t time. Roz I...
Please, everyone, find your formations. Get ahold of yourselves. Gad, it’s no use.
Wait! Rozzums can’t hurt you! Their inhibition protocols prevent deliberate conflict or harm to others.
You’re not afraid of them. You grew up with these things.
Whoa, whoa, whoa, I don’t understand.
They’re panicked. You’re not. Right now our only chance is to be led out by someone that doesn’t think like a goose. Follow me.
Yeah, why not. Okay. There’s nothing I can do that you can’t. Here we go!
Tight turn! Come on! Dive! Now, climb! That’s it!
Hah. Glad I lived long enough to see that. I’ll buy you some time.
Follow Brightbill. Don’t wait for me.
Keep up.
That’s it. Faster. Hurry. Come on.
